title: Secure Resource Management in Cloud Computing: Challenges, Strategies and Meta-Analysis
authors: Deepika Saxena, Smruti Rekha Swain, Jatinder Kumar, Sakshi Patni, Kishu Gupta, Ashutosh Kumar Singh, Volker Lindenstruth
abstract_summary: Examines cybersecurity in cloud resource management; categorizes threat countermeasures into defensive, mitigating, and hybrid strategies using VM data traces

title: Proof of Cloud: Data Center Execution Assurance for Confidential VMs
authors: Filip Rezabek, Moe Mahhouk, Andrew Miller, Stefan Genchev, Quintus Kilbourn, Georg Carle, Jonathan Passerat-Palmbach
abstract_summary: Introduces DCEA mechanism to verify confidential VMs run on trusted hardware; binds CVMs to underlying platforms using TPM measurements; mitigates replay and attestation proxying attacks

title: Risk-Aware Sensitive Property-Driven Resource Management in Cloud Datacenters
authors: Muhamad Felemban, Abdulrahman Almutairi, Arif Ghafoor
abstract_summary: Addresses multi-tenant cloud security through information-theoretic data sensitivity measures; develops resource allocation mechanisms to mitigate data leakage risks from untrusted tenants

title: CloudLens: Modeling and Detecting Cloud Security Vulnerabilities
authors: Mikhail Kazdagli, Mohit Tiwari, Akshat Kumar
abstract_summary: Models cloud security through planning-based approach to detect IAM misconfigurations; validates against 14 AWS configurations; identifies vulnerabilities missed by industry tools

title: Establishing a Baseline of Software Supply Chain Security Task Adoption by Software Organizations
abstract_summary: Empirical study of SSC security adoption; presents Proactive-SSCRM framework synthesizing NIST, OpenSSF, CISA, and CNCF guidelines; identifies early-stage adoption for emerging threats

title: SoK: Analysis of Software Supply Chain Security by Establishing Secure Design Properties
authors: Chinenye Okafor, Taylor R. Schorlemmer, Santiago Torres-Arias, James C. Davis
abstract_summary: Proposes three core security properties for supply chains: transparency, validity, and separation; systematically analyzes security frameworks and identifies gaps in existing defenses

title: An Empirical Study of Vulnerability Detection using Federated Learning
authors: Peiheng Zhou, Ming Hu, Xingrun Quan, Yawen Peng, Xiaofei Xie, Yanxin Yang, Chengwei Liu, Yueming Wu, Mingsong Chen
abstract_summary: Establishes evaluation framework for FL-based vulnerability detection; demonstrates FL improves detection performance on common CWEs compared to isolated training; addresses privacy-preserving collaboration

title: Third-party compliance reviews for frontier AI safety frameworks
authors: Aidan Homewood, Sophie Williams, Noemi Dreksler, John Lidiard, Malcolm Murray, Lennart Heim, Marta Ziosi, Seán Ó hÉigeartaigh, Michael Chen, Kevin Wei, Christoph Winter, Miles Brundage, Ben Garfinkel, Jonas Schuett
abstract_summary: Explores third-party compliance verification mechanisms for AI safety; proposes minimalist, ambitious, and comprehensive assessment approaches; addresses reviewer selection, methodologies, and disclosure options

title: A Frontier AI Risk Management Framework: Bridging the Gap Between Current AI Practices and Established Risk Management
authors: Simeon Campos, Henry Papadatos, Fabien Roger, Chloé Touzet, Otter Quarks, Malcolm Murray
abstract_summary: Integrates established risk management principles with AI-specific practices; four-component approach: identification, analysis, treatment, governance; emphasizes containment, deployment controls, and assurance

title: We Should Identify and Mitigate Third-Party Safety Risks in MCP-Powered Agent Systems
authors: Junfeng Fang, Zijun Yao, Ruipeng Wang, Haokai Ma, Xiang Wang, Tat-Seng Chua
abstract_summary: Directly addresses third-party MCP safety risks in agent systems; demonstrates that MCPs introduce potentially malicious uncontrolled services; proposes red teaming, safety evaluation, and ecosystem safeguards

title: Trusted AI Agents in the Cloud
authors: Teofil Bodea, Masanori Misono, Julian Pritzi, Patrick Sabanic, Thore Sommer, Harshavardhan Unnibhavi, David Schall, Nuno Santos, Dimitrios Stavrakakis, Pramod Bhatotia
abstract_summary: Implements Omega platform for trusted multi-tenant AI agents in cloud; provides nested isolation, verifiable cross-principal trust, policy-driven governance; deployed on AMD SEV-SNP and NVIDIA H100

title: Murakkab: Resource-Efficient Agentic Workflow Orchestration in Cloud Platforms
authors: Gohar Irfan Chaudhry, Esha Choukse, Haoran Qiu, Íñigo Goiri, Rodrigo Fonseca, Adam Belay, Ricardo Bianchini
abstract_summary: Decouples workflow specification from execution configuration in cloud platforms; achieves 2.8× GPU reduction, 3.7× energy savings, 4.3× cost reduction; balances accuracy, latency, energy, cost trade-offs

title: A Survey on Agentic Security: Applications, Threats and Defenses
authors: Asif Shahriar, Md Nafiu Rahman, Sadif Ahmed, Farig Sadeque, Md Rizwan Parvez
abstract_summary: Comprehensive survey of agentic security landscape; taxonomy of 160+ papers; three pillars: applications, threats, defenses; addresses agent vulnerabilities and protective countermeasures

title: Fuse and Federate: Enhancing EV Charging Station Security with Multimodal Fusion and Federated Learning
authors: Rabah Rahal, Abdelaziz Amara Korba, Yacine Ghamri-Doudane
abstract_summary: Federated intrusion detection using multimodal fusion (network traffic + kernel events); achieves 98%+ detection rate and 97%+ precision; privacy-preserving collaborative learning in distributed infrastructure
